title: Raptor Ridge 2014 Sparkling Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Produced from Hartzinger Vineyard Pinot Noir, this potent bubbly spent three years en tirage. It's a sunset copper color, with tangy strawberry and cherry flavors. Bubbles are compact, and the wine has the requisite acidity, finishing with a refreshing burst of minerality.

title: Rioja Vega 2014 Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: Ripe red-fruit aromas are slightly candied and include notes of brick dust and baking spices. On the palate, this is lively and in good health. Savory, lightly roasted plum and currant flavors finish steady, with freshness, residual red-fruit flavors and finally some noticeable oak. Drink through 2021.

title: Riverbench 2015 Cork Jumper Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Hay yellow in the glass, this vibrant bubbly, made from Chardonnay, offers aromas of toast and shaved nectarine on the nose. The palate is loaded with lemon flavors, proving tangy, tart and pleasantly sour as it rides across the creamy mousse.

title: Robert Biale 2015 EBA Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: An extended barrel-aged red, given 30 months to settle in French oak, this wine remains thick and chewy on the palate, a fistful of red raspberry and blackberry finding supportive acidity to boost the fruit. Bark, oak and graham cracker characteristics add richness and complexity. Enjoy best 2025 through 2030.

title: Robert Biale 2015 Like Father, Like Son Syrah-Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Smooth and velvety with a taste of black pepper, leather, fig and gravel, this wine integrates its tannin and oak well, allowing room for complexity and freshness to flourish. It has aspects of violet and lavender and a richness on the finish that speaks to blackberry jam.

title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2016 Pinot Noir  (Sancerre)
description: This rich wine shows great balance between its tannins and its broad black-cherry flavors. It offers pure fruitiness, acidity and a perfumed, dry core. The wine is just ready to drink.

title: Schloss Schönborn 2016 Graf von Schönborn Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)
description: This is a dry, mineral wine, with a bold backbone of crushed slate and smoke. Full bodied and quite creamy in texture, it's a satisfying Riesling with inviting hints of citrus, tropical melon and cookie crumbs that linger on the finish. Enjoy now through 2023.

title: Siduri 2016 Clos Pepe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Red-cherry compote, star anise, red licorice and a hint of vanilla show on the nose of this bottling from one of Adam Lee's longtime sources in the region. The palate offers rusty and earth flavors of baked cherry, but is quite snappy and crisp, enhanced by oregano, pepper and dried flowers.

title: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2014 Elivette Red (Spring Mountain District)
description: This is a lovely, structured blend half Cabernet Sauvignon with 17% Petit Verdot, 15% Malbec, 14% Cabernet Franc and 4% Merlot, from the mountainous estate. Opening in a sweet nose of sage and vanilla, it's savory in red currant and cassis, with grippy tannins. Enjoy best from 2024–2030.

title: Talisman 2014 Gunsalus Vineyard Dijon Clone 114 Méthode Ancienne Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft, light and grippy on the midpalate in toasted oak and firm tannin, this is moderately structured and fully ripe, brimming in black cherry, cola and clove.
designation: Gunsalus Vineyard Dijon Clone 114 Méthode Ancienne

title: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2015 Agnès Sorel  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: This is a ripe, smoky wine, with soft tannins and swathes of red fruits. It is still young, with a stalky character, but it will fill out as it matures because the weight and the tannins are very present. Drink from 2020. It is named after a mistress of King Charles VII of France.

title: Keuka Spring 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: A fragrant perfume of rose petals, melon, ginger and white pepper spice comes together in the glass. Succulent in feel, the palate is broad and oily, with supportive acidity and mild astringency maintaining balance. Flavors of juicy yellow apple, melon and spiced potpourri broaden the midpalate and lead to a delicate jasmine note on the lingering finish.

title: 12 Linajes 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky black-fruit aromas meet the basics for a top-notch Ribera wine. While this grinds a bit on the palate, it's not too scouring. Bold berry flavors show a saucy gamy side on a finish with mild heat and scrappy intensity. Drink through 2025.

title: A.R. Lenoble  NV Rosé Terroirs  (Champagne)
description: As in all this producer's wines, a good proportion is aged in wood before blending. This gives the house style of richness and tight spice, balancing the dry nature of the wine. All Chardonnay except for the Pinot Noir to give color, this rosé is taut, crisp, light in color and ready to drink.

title: Angove 2016 Warboys Vineyard Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: An enticing nose of mocha, raisiny plum fruit, vanilla and licorice glide gracefully into a well-balanced palate. This is silky, smooth in feel, with tightly structured tannins and a finish of cedar and black pepper. Drink now–2028.

title: Anthesis 2016 Stermer & Briscoe Vineyards Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Anthesis (not antithesis!) is produced and marketed by Blue Apron, one of several online start-ups offering home delivered fresh foods. This vineyard-designated, organically grown wine is a genuinely substantial effort. Black cherry and raspberry jam push flavors forward, while firm tannins and a touch of black olive keep the finish textural and lingering. It's packaged in a 500 ml bottle, perfect with that dinner for two.

title: Archery Summit 2016 Dundee Hills Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The first of the winery's 2016s, this young wine shows tart pomegranate and white raspberry fruits, with a hint of watermelon, as one might find in a rosé. Fermented in a mix of oak, concrete and stainless steel, the resulting blend is lighter than the previous vintage, with a well-balanced, savory finish.

title: Argyle 2016 Spirithouse Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Sourced from the Knudsen vineyard, this medium-bodied effort brings flavors of brambly berries and a touch of wet stone. It seems to trail off a bit in the finish, leaving a light lick of citrus as it fades.

title: Atrea 2016 Old Soul Red (Mendocino County)
description: Bold in flavor and stiff in structure, this full-bodied wine is laced with strong tannins and will need rich, fatty food to pair with. Still, it reveals nicely concentrated blueberry and blackberry flavors, subdued oak accents and a well-concentrated and layered composition.

title: Ayala NV Brut Majeur  (Champagne)
description: The nonvintage cuvée from this producer, this bottling exemplifies the drier style that's the firm's hallmark. It is elegant, a fruity wine that is also crisply textured. Drink now.
